123#ifndef OPENSSL_HEADER_BN_INTERNAL_H
124#define OPENSSL_HEADER_BN_INTERNAL_H
125
126#include <openssl/bn.h>
127
128#if defined(OPENSSL_X86_64) && defined(_MSC_VER)
129OPENSSL_MSVC_PRAGMA(warning(push, 3))
130#include <intrin.h>
131OPENSSL_MSVC_PRAGMA(warning(pop))
132#pragma intrinsic(__umulh, _umul128)
133#endif
134
135#include "../../internal.h"
136
137#if defined(__cplusplus)
138extern "C" {
139#endif
140
141#if defined(OPENSSL_64_BIT)
142
143#if defined(BORINGSSL_HAS_UINT128)
144// MSVC doesn't support two-word integers on 64-bit.
145#define BN_ULLONG uint128_t
146#if defined(BORINGSSL_CAN_DIVIDE_UINT128)
147#define BN_CAN_DIVIDE_ULLONG
148#endif
149#endif
150
151#define BN_BITS2 64
152#define BN_BYTES 8
153#define BN_BITS4 32
154#define BN_MASK2 (0xffffffffffffffffUL)
155#define BN_MASK2l (0xffffffffUL)
156#define BN_MASK2h (0xffffffff00000000UL)
157#define BN_MASK2h1 (0xffffffff80000000UL)
158#define BN_MONT_CTX_N0_LIMBS 1
159#define BN_DEC_CONV (10000000000000000000UL)
160#define BN_DEC_NUM 19
161#define TOBN(hi, lo) ((BN_ULONG)(hi) << 32 | (lo))
162
163#elif defined(OPENSSL_32_BIT)
164
165#define BN_ULLONG uint64_t
166#define BN_CAN_DIVIDE_ULLONG
167#define BN_BITS2 32
168#define BN_BYTES 4
169#define BN_BITS4 16
170#define BN_MASK2 (0xffffffffUL)
171#define BN_MASK2l (0xffffUL)
172#define BN_MASK2h1 (0xffff8000UL)
173#define BN_MASK2h (0xffff0000UL)
174// On some 32-bit platforms, Montgomery multiplication is done using 64-bit
175// arithmetic with SIMD instructions. On such platforms, |BN_MONT_CTX::n0|
176// needs to be two words long. Only certain 32-bit platforms actually make use
177// of n0[1] and shorter R value would suffice for the others. However,
178// currently only the assembly files know which is which.
179#define BN_MONT_CTX_N0_LIMBS 2
180#define BN_DEC_CONV (1000000000UL)
181#define BN_DEC_NUM 9
182#define TOBN(hi, lo) (lo), (hi)
183
184#else
185#error "Must define either OPENSSL_32_BIT or OPENSSL_64_BIT"
186#endif
187
188#if !defined(OPENSSL_NO_ASM) && (defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__clang__))
189#define BN_CAN_USE_INLINE_ASM
190#endif
191
192// |BN_mod_exp_mont_consttime| is based on the assumption that the L1 data
193// cache line width of the target processor is at least the following value.
194#define MOD_EXP_CTIME_MIN_CACHE_LINE_WIDTH 64
195
196// The number of |BN_ULONG|s needed for the |BN_mod_exp_mont_consttime| stack-
197// allocated storage buffer. The buffer is just the right size for the RSAZ
198// and is about ~1KB larger than what's necessary (4480 bytes) for 1024-bit
199// inputs.
200#define MOD_EXP_CTIME_STORAGE_LEN \
201 (((320u * 3u) + (32u * 9u * 16u)) / sizeof(BN_ULONG))
202
203#define STATIC_BIGNUM(x) \
204 { \
205 (BN_ULONG *)(x), sizeof(x) / sizeof(BN_ULONG), \
206 sizeof(x) / sizeof(BN_ULONG), 0, BN_FLG_STATIC_DATA \
207 }
208
209#if defined(BN_ULLONG)
210#define Lw(t) ((BN_ULONG)(t))
211#define Hw(t) ((BN_ULONG)((t) >> BN_BITS2))
212#endif
213
214// bn_minimal_width returns the minimal value of |bn->top| which fits the
215// value of |bn|.
216int bn_minimal_width(const BIGNUM *bn);
217
218// bn_set_minimal_width sets |bn->width| to |bn_minimal_width(bn)|. If |bn| is
219// zero, |bn->neg| is set to zero.
220void bn_set_minimal_width(BIGNUM *bn);
221
222// bn_wexpand ensures that |bn| has at least |words| works of space without
223// altering its value. It returns one on success or zero on allocation
224// failure.
225int bn_wexpand(BIGNUM *bn, size_t words);
226
227// bn_expand acts the same as |bn_wexpand|, but takes a number of bits rather
228// than a number of words.
229int bn_expand(BIGNUM *bn, size_t bits);
230
231// bn_resize_words adjusts |bn->top| to be |words|. It returns one on success
232// and zero on allocation error or if |bn|'s value is too large.
233OPENSSL_EXPORT int bn_resize_words(BIGNUM *bn, size_t words);
234
235// bn_select_words sets |r| to |a| if |mask| is all ones or |b| if |mask| is
236// all zeros.
237void bn_select_words(BN_ULONG *r, BN_ULONG mask, const BN_ULONG *a,
238 const BN_ULONG *b, size_t num);
239
240// bn_set_words sets |bn| to the value encoded in the |num| words in |words|,
241// least significant word first.
242int bn_set_words(BIGNUM *bn, const BN_ULONG *words, size_t num);
243
244// bn_set_static_words acts like |bn_set_words|, but doesn't copy the data. A
245// flag is set on |bn| so that |BN_free| won't attempt to free the data.
246//
247// The |STATIC_BIGNUM| macro is probably a better solution for this outside of
248// the FIPS module. Inside of the FIPS module that macro generates rel.ro data,
249// which doesn't work with FIPS requirements.
250void bn_set_static_words(BIGNUM *bn, const BN_ULONG *words, size_t num);
251
252// bn_fits_in_words returns one if |bn| may be represented in |num| words, plus
253// a sign bit, and zero otherwise.
254int bn_fits_in_words(const BIGNUM *bn, size_t num);
255
256// bn_copy_words copies the value of |bn| to |out| and returns one if the value
257// is representable in |num| words. Otherwise, it returns zero.
258int bn_copy_words(BN_ULONG *out, size_t num, const BIGNUM *bn);
259
260// bn_mul_add_words multiples |ap| by |w|, adds the result to |rp|, and places
261// the result in |rp|. |ap| and |rp| must both be |num| words long. It returns
262// the carry word of the operation. |ap| and |rp| may be equal but otherwise may
263// not alias.
264BN_ULONG bn_mul_add_words(BN_ULONG *rp, const BN_ULONG *ap, size_t num,
265 BN_ULONG w);
266
267// bn_mul_words multiples |ap| by |w| and places the result in |rp|. |ap| and
268// |rp| must both be |num| words long. It returns the carry word of the
269// operation. |ap| and |rp| may be equal but otherwise may not alias.
270BN_ULONG bn_mul_words(BN_ULONG *rp, const BN_ULONG *ap, size_t num, BN_ULONG w);
271
272// bn_sqr_words sets |rp[2*i]| and |rp[2*i+1]| to |ap[i]|'s square, for all |i|
273// up to |num|. |ap| is an array of |num| words and |rp| an array of |2*num|
274// words. |ap| and |rp| may not alias.
275//
276// This gives the contribution of the |ap[i]*ap[i]| terms when squaring |ap|.
277void bn_sqr_words(BN_ULONG *rp, const BN_ULONG *ap, size_t num);
278
279// bn_add_words adds |ap| to |bp| and places the result in |rp|, each of which
280// are |num| words long. It returns the carry bit, which is one if the operation
281// overflowed and zero otherwise. Any pair of |ap|, |bp|, and |rp| may be equal
282// to each other but otherwise may not alias.
283BN_ULONG bn_add_words(BN_ULONG *rp, const BN_ULONG *ap, const BN_ULONG *bp,
284 size_t num);
285
286// bn_sub_words subtracts |bp| from |ap| and places the result in |rp|. It
287// returns the borrow bit, which is one if the computation underflowed and zero
288// otherwise. Any pair of |ap|, |bp|, and |rp| may be equal to each other but
289// otherwise may not alias.
290BN_ULONG bn_sub_words(BN_ULONG *rp, const BN_ULONG *ap, const BN_ULONG *bp,
291 size_t num);
292
293// bn_mul_comba4 sets |r| to the product of |a| and |b|.
294void bn_mul_comba4(BN_ULONG r[8], const BN_ULONG a[4], const BN_ULONG b[4]);
295
296// bn_mul_comba8 sets |r| to the product of |a| and |b|.
297void bn_mul_comba8(BN_ULONG r[16], const BN_ULONG a[8], const BN_ULONG b[8]);
298
299// bn_sqr_comba8 sets |r| to |a|^2.
300void bn_sqr_comba8(BN_ULONG r[16], const BN_ULONG a[8]);
301
302// bn_sqr_comba4 sets |r| to |a|^2.
303void bn_sqr_comba4(BN_ULONG r[8], const BN_ULONG a[4]);
304
305// bn_less_than_words returns one if |a| < |b| and zero otherwise, where |a|
306// and |b| both are |len| words long. It runs in constant time.
307int bn_less_than_words(const BN_ULONG *a, const BN_ULONG *b, size_t len);
308
309// bn_in_range_words returns one if |min_inclusive| <= |a| < |max_exclusive|,
310// where |a| and |max_exclusive| both are |len| words long. |a| and
311// |max_exclusive| are treated as secret.
312int bn_in_range_words(const BN_ULONG *a, BN_ULONG min_inclusive,
313 const BN_ULONG *max_exclusive, size_t len);
314
315// bn_rand_range_words sets |out| to a uniformly distributed random number from
316// |min_inclusive| to |max_exclusive|. Both |out| and |max_exclusive| are |len|
317// words long.
318//
319// This function runs in time independent of the result, but |min_inclusive| and
320// |max_exclusive| are public data. (Information about the range is unavoidably
321// leaked by how many iterations it took to select a number.)
322int bn_rand_range_words(BN_ULONG *out, BN_ULONG min_inclusive,
323 const BN_ULONG *max_exclusive, size_t len,
324 const uint8_t additional_data[32]);
325
326// bn_range_secret_range behaves like |BN_rand_range_ex|, but treats
327// |max_exclusive| as secret. Because of this constraint, the distribution of
328// values returned is more complex.
329//
330// Rather than repeatedly generating values until one is in range, which would
331// leak information, it generates one value. If the value is in range, it sets
332// |*out_is_uniform| to one. Otherwise, it sets |*out_is_uniform| to zero,
333// fixing up the value to force it in range.
334//
335// The subset of calls to |bn_rand_secret_range| which set |*out_is_uniform| to
336// one are uniformly distributed in the target range. Calls overall are not.
337// This function is intended for use in situations where the extra values are
338// still usable and where the number of iterations needed to reach the target
339// number of uniform outputs may be blinded for negligible probabilities of
340// timing leaks.
341//
342// Although this function treats |max_exclusive| as secret, it treats the number
343// of bits in |max_exclusive| as public.
344int bn_rand_secret_range(BIGNUM *r, int *out_is_uniform, BN_ULONG min_inclusive,
345 const BIGNUM *max_exclusive);
346
347#if !defined(OPENSSL_NO_ASM) && \
348 (defined(OPENSSL_X86) || defined(OPENSSL_X86_64) || \
349 defined(OPENSSL_ARM) || defined(OPENSSL_AARCH64))
350#define OPENSSL_BN_ASM_MONT
351// bn_mul_mont writes |ap| * |bp| mod |np| to |rp|, each |num| words
352// long. Inputs and outputs are in Montgomery form. |n0| is a pointer to the
353// corresponding field in |BN_MONT_CTX|. It returns one if |bn_mul_mont| handles
354// inputs of this size and zero otherwise.
355//
356// TODO(davidben): The x86_64 implementation expects a 32-bit input and masks
357// off upper bits. The aarch64 implementation expects a 64-bit input and does
358// not. |size_t| is the safer option but not strictly correct for x86_64. But
359// this function implicitly already has a bound on the size of |num| because it
360// internally creates |num|-sized stack allocation.
361//
362// See also discussion in |ToWord| in abi_test.h for notes on smaller-than-word
363// inputs.
364int bn_mul_mont(BN_ULONG *rp, const BN_ULONG *ap, const BN_ULONG *bp,
365 const BN_ULONG *np, const BN_ULONG *n0, size_t num);
366#endif
367
368#if !defined(OPENSSL_NO_ASM) && defined(OPENSSL_X86_64)
369#define OPENSSL_BN_ASM_MONT5
370
371// bn_mul_mont_gather5 multiples loads index |power| of |table|, multiplies it
372// by |ap| modulo |np|, and stores the result in |rp|. The values are |num|
373// words long and represented in Montgomery form. |n0| is a pointer to the
374// corresponding field in |BN_MONT_CTX|.
375void bn_mul_mont_gather5(BN_ULONG *rp, const BN_ULONG *ap,
376 const BN_ULONG *table, const BN_ULONG *np,
377 const BN_ULONG *n0, int num, int power);
378
379// bn_scatter5 stores |inp| to index |power| of |table|. |inp| and each entry of
380// |table| are |num| words long. |power| must be less than 32. |table| must be
381// 32*|num| words long.
382void bn_scatter5(const BN_ULONG *inp, size_t num, BN_ULONG *table,
383 size_t power);
384
385// bn_gather5 loads index |power| of |table| and stores it in |out|. |out| and
386// each entry of |table| are |num| words long. |power| must be less than 32.
387void bn_gather5(BN_ULONG *out, size_t num, BN_ULONG *table, size_t power);
388
389// bn_power5 squares |ap| five times and multiplies it by the value stored at
390// index |power| of |table|, modulo |np|. It stores the result in |rp|. The
391// values are |num| words long and represented in Montgomery form. |n0| is a
392// pointer to the corresponding field in |BN_MONT_CTX|. |num| must be divisible
393// by 8.
394void bn_power5(BN_ULONG *rp, const BN_ULONG *ap, const BN_ULONG *table,
395 const BN_ULONG *np, const BN_ULONG *n0, int num, int power);
396
397// bn_from_montgomery converts |ap| from Montgomery form modulo |np| and writes
398// the result in |rp|, each of which is |num| words long. It returns one on
399// success and zero if it cannot handle inputs of length |num|. |n0| is a
400// pointer to the corresponding field in |BN_MONT_CTX|.
401int bn_from_montgomery(BN_ULONG *rp, const BN_ULONG *ap,
402 const BN_ULONG *not_used, const BN_ULONG *np,
403 const BN_ULONG *n0, int num);
404#endif // !OPENSSL_NO_ASM && OPENSSL_X86_64
405
406uint64_t bn_mont_n0(const BIGNUM *n);
407
408// bn_mod_exp_base_2_consttime calculates r = 2**p (mod n). |p| must be larger
409// than log_2(n); i.e. 2**p must be larger than |n|. |n| must be positive and
410// odd. |p| and the bit width of |n| are assumed public, but |n| is otherwise
411// treated as secret.
412int bn_mod_exp_base_2_consttime(BIGNUM *r, unsigned p, const BIGNUM *n,
413 BN_CTX *ctx);
414
415#if defined(_MSC_VER)
416#if defined(OPENSSL_X86_64)
417#define BN_UMULT_LOHI(low, high, a, b) ((low) = _umul128((a), (b), &(high)))
418#elif defined(OPENSSL_AARCH64)
419#define BN_UMULT_LOHI(low, high, a, b) \
420 do { \
421 const BN_ULONG _a = (a); \
422 const BN_ULONG _b = (b); \
423 (low) = _a * _b; \
424 (high) = __umulh(_a, _b); \
425 } while (0)
426#endif
427#endif // _MSC_VER
428
429#if !defined(BN_ULLONG) && !defined(BN_UMULT_LOHI)
430#error "Either BN_ULLONG or BN_UMULT_LOHI must be defined on every platform."
431#endif
432
433// bn_jacobi returns the Jacobi symbol of |a| and |b| (which is -1, 0 or 1), or
434// -2 on error.
435int bn_jacobi(const BIGNUM *a, const BIGNUM *b, BN_CTX *ctx);
436
437// bn_is_bit_set_words returns one if bit |bit| is set in |a| and zero
438// otherwise.
439int bn_is_bit_set_words(const BN_ULONG *a, size_t num, unsigned bit);
440
441// bn_one_to_montgomery sets |r| to one in Montgomery form. It returns one on
442// success and zero on error. This function treats the bit width of the modulus
443// as public.
444int bn_one_to_montgomery(BIGNUM *r, const BN_MONT_CTX *mont, BN_CTX *ctx);
445
446// bn_less_than_montgomery_R returns one if |bn| is less than the Montgomery R
447// value for |mont| and zero otherwise.
448int bn_less_than_montgomery_R(const BIGNUM *bn, const BN_MONT_CTX *mont);
449
450// bn_mod_u16_consttime returns |bn| mod |d|, ignoring |bn|'s sign bit. It runs
451// in time independent of the value of |bn|, but it treats |d| as public.
452OPENSSL_EXPORT uint16_t bn_mod_u16_consttime(const BIGNUM *bn, uint16_t d);
453
454// bn_odd_number_is_obviously_composite returns one if |bn| is divisible by one
455// of the first several odd primes and zero otherwise.
456int bn_odd_number_is_obviously_composite(const BIGNUM *bn);
457
458// A BN_MILLER_RABIN stores state common to each Miller-Rabin iteration. It is
459// initialized within an existing |BN_CTX| scope and may not be used after
460// that scope is released with |BN_CTX_end|. Field names match those in FIPS
461// 186-4, section C.3.1.
462typedef struct {
463 // w1 is w-1.
464 BIGNUM *w1;
465 // m is (w-1)/2^a.
466 BIGNUM *m;
467 // one_mont is 1 (mod w) in Montgomery form.
468 BIGNUM *one_mont;
469 // w1_mont is w-1 (mod w) in Montgomery form.
470 BIGNUM *w1_mont;
471 // w_bits is BN_num_bits(w).
472 int w_bits;
473 // a is the largest integer such that 2^a divides w-1.
474 int a;
475} BN_MILLER_RABIN;
476
477// bn_miller_rabin_init initializes |miller_rabin| for testing if |mont->N| is
478// prime. It returns one on success and zero on error.
479OPENSSL_EXPORT int bn_miller_rabin_init(BN_MILLER_RABIN *miller_rabin,
480 const BN_MONT_CTX *mont, BN_CTX *ctx);
481
482// bn_miller_rabin_iteration performs one Miller-Rabin iteration, checking if
483// |b| is a composite witness for |mont->N|. |miller_rabin| must have been
484// initialized with |bn_miller_rabin_setup|. On success, it returns one and sets
485// |*out_is_possibly_prime| to one if |mont->N| may still be prime or zero if
486// |b| shows it is composite. On allocation or internal failure, it returns
487// zero.
488OPENSSL_EXPORT int bn_miller_rabin_iteration(
489 const BN_MILLER_RABIN *miller_rabin, int *out_is_possibly_prime,
490 const BIGNUM *b, const BN_MONT_CTX *mont, BN_CTX *ctx);
491
492// bn_rshift1_words sets |r| to |a| >> 1, where both arrays are |num| bits wide.
493void bn_rshift1_words(BN_ULONG *r, const BN_ULONG *a, size_t num);
494
495// bn_rshift_words sets |r| to |a| >> |shift|, where both arrays are |num| bits
496// wide.
497void bn_rshift_words(BN_ULONG *r, const BN_ULONG *a, unsigned shift,
498 size_t num);
499
500// bn_rshift_secret_shift behaves like |BN_rshift| but runs in time independent
501// of both |a| and |n|.
502OPENSSL_EXPORT int bn_rshift_secret_shift(BIGNUM *r, const BIGNUM *a,
503 unsigned n, BN_CTX *ctx);
504
505// bn_reduce_once sets |r| to |a| mod |m| where 0 <= |a| < 2*|m|. It returns
506// zero if |a| < |m| and a mask of all ones if |a| >= |m|. Each array is |num|
507// words long, but |a| has an additional word specified by |carry|. |carry| must
508// be zero or one, as implied by the bounds on |a|.
509//
510// |r|, |a|, and |m| may not alias. Use |bn_reduce_once_in_place| if |r| and |a|
511// must alias.
512BN_ULONG bn_reduce_once(BN_ULONG *r, const BN_ULONG *a, BN_ULONG carry,
513 const BN_ULONG *m, size_t num);
514
515// bn_reduce_once_in_place behaves like |bn_reduce_once| but acts in-place on
516// |r|, using |tmp| as scratch space. |r|, |tmp|, and |m| may not alias.
517BN_ULONG bn_reduce_once_in_place(BN_ULONG *r, BN_ULONG carry, const BN_ULONG *m,
518 BN_ULONG *tmp, size_t num);
519
520
521// Constant-time non-modular arithmetic.
522//
523// The following functions implement non-modular arithmetic in constant-time
524// and pessimally set |r->width| to the largest possible word size.
525//
526// Note this means that, e.g., repeatedly multiplying by one will cause widths
527// to increase without bound. The corresponding public API functions minimize
528// their outputs to avoid regressing calculator consumers.
529
530// bn_uadd_consttime behaves like |BN_uadd|, but it pessimally sets
531// |r->width| = |a->width| + |b->width| + 1.
532int bn_uadd_consttime(BIGNUM *r, const BIGNUM *a, const BIGNUM *b);
533
534// bn_usub_consttime behaves like |BN_usub|, but it pessimally sets
535// |r->width| = |a->width|.
536int bn_usub_consttime(BIGNUM *r, const BIGNUM *a, const BIGNUM *b);
537
538// bn_abs_sub_consttime sets |r| to the absolute value of |a| - |b|, treating
539// both inputs as secret. It returns one on success and zero on error.
540OPENSSL_EXPORT int bn_abs_sub_consttime(BIGNUM *r, const BIGNUM *a,
541 const BIGNUM *b, BN_CTX *ctx);
542
543// bn_mul_consttime behaves like |BN_mul|, but it rejects negative inputs and
544// pessimally sets |r->width| to |a->width| + |b->width|, to avoid leaking
545// information about |a| and |b|.
546int bn_mul_consttime(BIGNUM *r, const BIGNUM *a, const BIGNUM *b, BN_CTX *ctx);
547
548// bn_sqrt_consttime behaves like |BN_sqrt|, but it pessimally sets |r->width|
549// to 2*|a->width|, to avoid leaking information about |a| and |b|.
550int bn_sqr_consttime(BIGNUM *r, const BIGNUM *a, BN_CTX *ctx);
551
552// bn_div_consttime behaves like |BN_div|, but it rejects negative inputs and
553// treats both inputs, including their magnitudes, as secret. It is, as a
554// result, much slower than |BN_div| and should only be used for rare operations
555// where Montgomery reduction is not available.
556//
557// Note that |quotient->width| will be set pessimally to |numerator->width|.
558OPENSSL_EXPORT int bn_div_consttime(BIGNUM *quotient, BIGNUM *remainder,
559 const BIGNUM *numerator,
560 const BIGNUM *divisor, BN_CTX *ctx);
561
562// bn_is_relatively_prime checks whether GCD(|x|, |y|) is one. On success, it
563// returns one and sets |*out_relatively_prime| to one if the GCD was one and
564// zero otherwise. On error, it returns zero.
565OPENSSL_EXPORT int bn_is_relatively_prime(int *out_relatively_prime,
566 const BIGNUM *x, const BIGNUM *y,
567 BN_CTX *ctx);
568
569// bn_lcm_consttime sets |r| to LCM(|a|, |b|). It returns one and success and
570// zero on error. |a| and |b| are both treated as secret.
571OPENSSL_EXPORT int bn_lcm_consttime(BIGNUM *r, const BIGNUM *a, const BIGNUM *b,
572 BN_CTX *ctx);
573
574
575// Constant-time modular arithmetic.
576//
577// The following functions implement basic constant-time modular arithmetic.
578
579// bn_mod_add_words sets |r| to |a| + |b| (mod |m|), using |tmp| as scratch
580// space. Each array is |num| words long. |a| and |b| must be < |m|. Any pair of
581// |r|, |a|, and |b| may alias.
582void bn_mod_add_words(BN_ULONG *r, const BN_ULONG *a, const BN_ULONG *b,
583 const BN_ULONG *m, BN_ULONG *tmp, size_t num);
584
585// bn_mod_add_consttime acts like |BN_mod_add_quick| but takes a |BN_CTX|.
586int bn_mod_add_consttime(BIGNUM *r, const BIGNUM *a, const BIGNUM *b,
587 const BIGNUM *m, BN_CTX *ctx);
588
589// bn_mod_sub_words sets |r| to |a| - |b| (mod |m|), using |tmp| as scratch
590// space. Each array is |num| words long. |a| and |b| must be < |m|. Any pair of
591// |r|, |a|, and |b| may alias.
592void bn_mod_sub_words(BN_ULONG *r, const BN_ULONG *a, const BN_ULONG *b,
593 const BN_ULONG *m, BN_ULONG *tmp, size_t num);
594
595// bn_mod_sub_consttime acts like |BN_mod_sub_quick| but takes a |BN_CTX|.
596int bn_mod_sub_consttime(BIGNUM *r, const BIGNUM *a, const BIGNUM *b,
597 const BIGNUM *m, BN_CTX *ctx);
598
599// bn_mod_lshift1_consttime acts like |BN_mod_lshift1_quick| but takes a
600// |BN_CTX|.
601int bn_mod_lshift1_consttime(BIGNUM *r, const BIGNUM *a, const BIGNUM *m,
602 BN_CTX *ctx);
603
604// bn_mod_lshift_consttime acts like |BN_mod_lshift_quick| but takes a |BN_CTX|.
605int bn_mod_lshift_consttime(BIGNUM *r, const BIGNUM *a, int n, const BIGNUM *m,
606 BN_CTX *ctx);
607
608// bn_mod_inverse_consttime sets |r| to |a|^-1, mod |n|. |a| must be non-
609// negative and less than |n|. It returns one on success and zero on error. On
610// failure, if the failure was caused by |a| having no inverse mod |n| then
611// |*out_no_inverse| will be set to one; otherwise it will be set to zero.
612//
613// This function treats both |a| and |n| as secret, provided they are both non-
614// zero and the inverse exists. It should only be used for even moduli where
615// none of the less general implementations are applicable.
616OPENSSL_EXPORT int bn_mod_inverse_consttime(BIGNUM *r, int *out_no_inverse,
617 const BIGNUM *a, const BIGNUM *n,
618 BN_CTX *ctx);
619
620// bn_mod_inverse_prime sets |out| to the modular inverse of |a| modulo |p|,
621// computed with Fermat's Little Theorem. It returns one on success and zero on
622// error. If |mont_p| is NULL, one will be computed temporarily.
623int bn_mod_inverse_prime(BIGNUM *out, const BIGNUM *a, const BIGNUM *p,
624 BN_CTX *ctx, const BN_MONT_CTX *mont_p);
625
626// bn_mod_inverse_secret_prime behaves like |bn_mod_inverse_prime| but uses
627// |BN_mod_exp_mont_consttime| instead of |BN_mod_exp_mont| in hopes of
628// protecting the exponent.
629int bn_mod_inverse_secret_prime(BIGNUM *out, const BIGNUM *a, const BIGNUM *p,
630 BN_CTX *ctx, const BN_MONT_CTX *mont_p);
631
632
633// Low-level operations for small numbers.
634//
635// The following functions implement algorithms suitable for use with scalars
636// and field elements in elliptic curves. They rely on the number being small
637// both to stack-allocate various temporaries and because they do not implement
638// optimizations useful for the larger values used in RSA.
639
640// BN_SMALL_MAX_WORDS is the largest size input these functions handle. This
641// limit allows temporaries to be more easily stack-allocated. This limit is set
642// to accommodate P-521.
643#if defined(OPENSSL_32_BIT)
644#define BN_SMALL_MAX_WORDS 17
645#else
646#define BN_SMALL_MAX_WORDS 9
647#endif
648
649// bn_mul_small sets |r| to |a|*|b|. |num_r| must be |num_a| + |num_b|. |r| may
650// not alias with |a| or |b|.
651void bn_mul_small(BN_ULONG *r, size_t num_r, const BN_ULONG *a, size_t num_a,
652 const BN_ULONG *b, size_t num_b);
653
654// bn_sqr_small sets |r| to |a|^2. |num_a| must be at most |BN_SMALL_MAX_WORDS|.
655// |num_r| must be |num_a|*2. |r| and |a| may not alias.
656void bn_sqr_small(BN_ULONG *r, size_t num_r, const BN_ULONG *a, size_t num_a);
657
658// In the following functions, the modulus must be at most |BN_SMALL_MAX_WORDS|
659// words long.
660
661// bn_to_montgomery_small sets |r| to |a| translated to the Montgomery domain.
662// |r| and |a| are |num| words long, which must be |mont->N.width|. |a| must be
663// fully reduced and may alias |r|.
664void bn_to_montgomery_small(BN_ULONG *r, const BN_ULONG *a, size_t num,
665 const BN_MONT_CTX *mont);
666
667// bn_from_montgomery_small sets |r| to |a| translated out of the Montgomery
668// domain. |r| and |a| are |num_r| and |num_a| words long, respectively. |num_r|
669// must be |mont->N.width|. |a| must be at most |mont->N|^2 and may alias |r|.
670//
671// Unlike most of these functions, only |num_r| is bounded by
672// |BN_SMALL_MAX_WORDS|. |num_a| may exceed it, but must be at most 2 * |num_r|.
673void bn_from_montgomery_small(BN_ULONG *r, size_t num_r, const BN_ULONG *a,
674 size_t num_a, const BN_MONT_CTX *mont);
675
676// bn_mod_mul_montgomery_small sets |r| to |a| * |b| mod |mont->N|. Both inputs
677// and outputs are in the Montgomery domain. Each array is |num| words long,
678// which must be |mont->N.width|. Any two of |r|, |a|, and |b| may alias. |a|
679// and |b| must be reduced on input.
680void bn_mod_mul_montgomery_small(BN_ULONG *r, const BN_ULONG *a,
681 const BN_ULONG *b, size_t num,
682 const BN_MONT_CTX *mont);
683
684// bn_mod_exp_mont_small sets |r| to |a|^|p| mod |mont->N|. It returns one on
685// success and zero on programmer or internal error. Both inputs and outputs are
686// in the Montgomery domain. |r| and |a| are |num| words long, which must be
687// |mont->N.width| and at most |BN_SMALL_MAX_WORDS|. |a| must be fully-reduced.
688// This function runs in time independent of |a|, but |p| and |mont->N| are
689// public values. |a| must be fully-reduced and may alias with |r|.
690//
691// Note this function differs from |BN_mod_exp_mont| which uses Montgomery
692// reduction but takes input and output outside the Montgomery domain. Combine
693// this function with |bn_from_montgomery_small| and |bn_to_montgomery_small|
694// if necessary.
695void bn_mod_exp_mont_small(BN_ULONG *r, const BN_ULONG *a, size_t num,
696 const BN_ULONG *p, size_t num_p,
697 const BN_MONT_CTX *mont);
698
699// bn_mod_inverse0_prime_mont_small sets |r| to |a|^-1 mod |mont->N|. If |a| is
700// zero, |r| is set to zero. |mont->N| must be a prime. |r| and |a| are |num|
701// words long, which must be |mont->N.width| and at most |BN_SMALL_MAX_WORDS|.
702// |a| must be fully-reduced and may alias |r|. This function runs in time
703// independent of |a|, but |mont->N| is a public value.
704void bn_mod_inverse0_prime_mont_small(BN_ULONG *r, const BN_ULONG *a,
705 size_t num, const BN_MONT_CTX *mont);
706
707
708#if defined(__cplusplus)
709} // extern C
710#endif
711
712#endif // OPENSSL_HEADER_BN_INTERNAL_H
